item.title: Is the whiskey industry in trouble?
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with bourbon expert Fred Minnick on what Jim Beam's halting distillation at main distillery reveals about the challenges facing the bourbon industry and the year ahead.

item.title: Small business owner shares how Trump's tariffs affected sales
item.description: President Trump's on-again, off-again tariffs on Chinese imports affected many U.S. businesses last year. We check in with one small business owner to ask what the year and holiday season were like.

item.description: After six decades running Berkshire Hathaway, the legendary investor Warren Buffett has officially stepped down as CEO.

item.title: Crypto soared in 2025 — and then crashed. Now what?

item.title: Jim Beam to pause production at its main plant in 2026
item.description: Kentucky bourbon maker Jim Beam says it won't distill bourbon at its main plant in Clermont, Kentucky, for all of 2026 because of economics and changing consumer tastes.

item.title: Warren Buffett is retiring: We look back at a critical turning point in his career
item.description: Warren Buffett started out by identifying opportunities in undervalued companies. Later, his strategy was buying a company that would get bigger on its own. We look at that second phase of his career.
